title: Nidalee in the grand scheme of things
body:
I know this has been an ongoing thing for a very long time, but.... Nidalee Spears leads to an unfun element of gameplay and needs to be seriously looked at.  I am fine with moving her more to an assassin roll with cougar form, what I am not fine with is dodging twelve spears only to get hit by one after two minutes and now I'm just out of the game, or worse if she flashes on me dead.  This feeling sucks so much.  Why should I be punished so incredibly hard for getting randomly hit by this skillshot?  It's 3/4 of an adc health pool from one spear.  Not to mention you have to commit so hard to catch her out of position.  Her entire kit screams deal with this champion, oh wait you can't.  Movespeed, dashes, long range nukes.  This just creates a very imbalanced and unfun game environment.  I can't count the number of games I have lost because nid managed to hit a single spear on someone and took them out of a fight to make it 4v5, when they were pushing for the win.  You just can't do anything about it.

The mana cost is low enough you can just spam it, and cougar costs nothing so there is no fear of being oom and useless in a fight.  Her only counterplay is dodge spears.  That's not really good enough if she lands one and done on you.  I just feel there is too much damage to such a long range ability.  Nothing like pushing for the win and going welp, now I have 10% hp from ONE nidalee spear, guess I should just leave.

And before we get anyone in here flaming me...
Tanks still take lots of damage from her.
Building MR on an ADC isn't good itemization and you basically ruin your item build.
Banshee's only stops one spear and can be popped by anyone on her team.
It doesn't matter if it's a skillshot that moves slowly or not, it's all reward and no risk since you can just constantly toss them out.

TL:DR
Nidalee spears create a poor game environment and over rewards nidalee for hitting one, making her too safe as an assassin.

No, you can't get it through YOUR mind that she's in not only a balanced state right now- she's in a shitty state. Her spears do 60%.
Sixty.
Percent.
of the damage the used to when she used to stay backline and just chuck spears at you. Now not only are her spears harder to hit, they do _way less damage now_ a squishy who has no MR can get maybe 1/4 health chunked off late game. That's about it. As i stated previously, if you stick around long enough to dodge 12, then get hit by one with 1/4 health, thats _your. fault._ yours. 

Apparently you can't understand why I keep talking about nerfs, because her spears used to be terrifying, and you could never catch her. They literally are not there for damage anymore, they're there for initiation because THEY DON'T DO HARDLY ANY DAMAGE. That's not what they're there for anymore. I'm bringing her nerfs up because you're complaining about a champ with a drastically lowered win rate because of how much they've nerfed her over the last year and some change. 

Not to mention, her win rate drops even _lower_ the longer the game goes on because nidalee _can't team fight_ she can sit back and kinda throw some spears where majority miss or hit the front line (unless you're one of those squishies who stays completely out of position then wants to bitch at everything that kills them) She can catch you out, and she can split push. but her relevance in teamfights is so weak because 9/10 she can't land spears to get the proc on her combo due to 1) nerfs 2) minions 3) people _easily_ dodging them now 4) them just hitting front line tanks to where no visible damage even comes off. 

It _very easy_ to seige nidalee because her only form of wave clear is her cougar form which makes her extremely vulnerable, ESPECIALLY against cc. If she can't wave clear she can't chuck her spears, this is why she makes a better jungle than a laner now. And considering all the changes, there's a lot better junglers than her now. She's _extremely_ mana hungry because half of her kit absolutely has to be performed in human form, and her mana costs are not cheap. Take it from someone getting level 5 nid by jungling, I've been playing her since she was a spear-chucking pain in the ass.

From where I'm standing you're just complaining over literally not knowing how to play against one, and doing badly when you do. This isn't a nidalee problem, this is a you problem.
Are you seriously asking for Nidalee nerfs when her spears were just nerfed and she's currently sitting at around a 45% win rate?

> Are you seriously asking for Nidalee nerfs when her spears were just nerfed and she's currently sitting at around a 45% win rate?

It's a 48% win ratio, not asking for nerfs, win rate does NOT change the fact that her kit is shitty and not fun from a game standpoint, and she was at 54% before 5.15, and is only falling out because of the resurgence of juggernauts.

"Why is it fair that Nid can miss ten spears and then hit one and she kills me?" is such a horrible question. It's fair because spending two minutes trying to get a kill but failing repeatedly is something that justifies a high reward for when you eventually succeed. In the time Nidalee throws ten spears any number of mages/assassins will have killed you seeeeeeeeeeeveral times.

You don't want it to be more reliable but weaker if you have any sense at all. It'd be a huge buff to her. You'll get hit by multiple spears in the same time that she would have hit 0-1 in the past, and you'll have to go back because multiple weak-ish spears will do just as much damage as one strong one anyway. Nidalee is much easier to beat, is riskier and has greater skill requirements when her spear is the single most difficult skillshot in the game to hit. You don't understand her or how irrational your feelings in relation to her gameplay are if you suggest changing that paradigm.

It is like Vayne and Garen united. And there are also traps that boost her ms and allow her to jump on you from further range while dealing more damage
